Authors:
Ravi K Singh, Klaus Gase, Ian T Baldwin, Shree P
Pandey
Title:
Molecular evolution and diversification of the Argonaute
family of proteins in plants
Keywords:
Argonaute, miRNA, plants, Nicotiana attenuata, herbivory,
evolution, small-RNA
Abstract:
Background: Argonaute (AGO) proteins form the core of the
RNA-induced silencing complex, a central component of the smRNA
machinery. Although reported from several plant species, little is known
about their evolution. Moreover, these genes have not yet been cloned
from the ecological model plant, Nicotiana attenuata, in which the smRNA
machinery is known to mediate important ecological traits.

trees.title: Neighbor Joining phylogenetic tree of all AGOs
Neighbor joining phylogenetic tree of plant AGOs
Maximum Likelihood phylogenetic tree of plant AGOs
